channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OH

item.title: Report E-2024070106
item.description:
Report E-2024070106

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-09T15:13:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-05
  • City: WEST CHESTER
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately 1/2 a cup of material released from one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and placed the spent absorbents into one (1) 5-gallon poly pail. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024070079
item.description:
Report E-2024070079

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-08T18:15:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-27
  • City: KENT
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When driver arrived at facility to drop trailer he opened door to check securement before dropping and noticed moisture on the floor by the pallet. Ther driver then put done absorbents and called the emergency number at 1900ET. There was no active leek at the time and the driver was able to contain the pallet as a precaution. The team showed up at 2000ET and repacked the container and the material was cleaned up and disposed of in the proper manor. the crew was complete at 2300ET.

Dayton Freight personnel cleaned the impacted area and containerized the cleanup debris and damaged pail into one (1) 15-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024070004
item.description:
Report E-2024070004

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-03T15:13:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-20
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 20, 2024, one (1) 95-gallon overpack of sodium hypochlorite fell off of a skid and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. Crews re-secured the fallen tote. TLE personnel deployed granular absorbents and cleaners to impacted dock and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 35-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2024070002
item.description:
Report E-2024070002

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-03T15:13:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-19
  • City: NORWALK
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 19, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of organic peroxide was punctured by a nail and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and a neutralizing agent to remediate the organic peroxide-impacted trailer floor. All impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and staged on site.

item.title: Report E-2024060133
item.description:
Report E-2024060133

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-03T15:13:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-04
  • City: CINCINNATI
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On Tuesday, 6/04/2024, at 1121 hours, an FRA Hazmat Inspector in the CSXT Queens Gate Yard discovered UTLX676824, a loaded tank car of Ammonium Nitrate, liquid, had leaked from the Vacuum Relief Valve (VRV). The car was isolated and the shipper, CF Industries Sales LLC, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report#2024-0604-00147). CSXT Hazmat personnel responded to the yard and observed dried product within the service equipment housing that had leaked from the VRV. The valve was not actively leaking at the time of response. The issue was identified as a defective Vacuum Relief Valve and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative, Roy Mathew, 224-804-7190, rmathew@cfindustries.com. The car was held out of transportation pending repair or replacement of the defective valve by a certified mobile repair unit.
